You can easily make an aeroshell with a fairing; in fact, that was one of the intended uses.

> 
> You can easily make an aeroshell with a fairing; in fact, that was one of the intended uses.

Can you show me a example?

Here you go:

![4tQNxV4.png](http://i.imgur.com/4tQNxV4.png)

It's \*very\* quick and dirty (not to mention a ridiculous weight for the payload it's protecting) but I'm sure it's possible to build a more elegant version using the same principles and smaller heatshield/fairing parts.

![QCS3y1f.jpg?1](http://i.imgur.com/QCS3y1f.jpg?1)

![cFvoY9l.jpg?1](http://i.imgur.com/cFvoY9l.jpg?1)

You can also turn the fairing upside-down, which lets you use a smaller fairing base. Lets you decouple the heatshield before the fairing too, Curiosity-style. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

EDIT: With further testing, it turns out this doesn't work \*quite\* as expected - the fairing breaks off if you decouple the heatshield first.
